column1: This #Thanksgiving may look different because of #COVID19 but there is so much to be grateful for.   Happy Thanksgiving everyone! #GiveThanks #TurkeyDay #HappyThanksgiving https://t.co/JW2dgsyokJ

We are seeing a similar spike of coronavirus cases that are comparable to April. We must stay diligent in wearing masks washing hands social distancing and staying home when sick to slow the spread. https://t.co/URK2K6m2q4

Coronavirus has devastated small businesses. The House passed the updated #HeroesAct to:   🏪 Improve the Paycheck Protection Program  💵 Provide hard-hit businesses with second loans 🍴 Deliver targeted assistance for restaurant & other industries https://t.co/pERcZh3D2f

As we head into cooler weather we must remember #coronavirus is far from over. It is more important now to practice social distancing and other good habits to slow the spread of it. #WearAMask wash your hands and stay home if you feel unwell. https://t.co/AKKhaA60pW

Last week I was proud to vote for H.Res.908. As coronavirus cases increased in the U.S. so have the number of attacks targeting Asian Americans. This is unacceptable. We cannot let the rise in hateful rhetoric and discrimination go unchecked.   Read my full statement below. https://t.co/VuoAJFAj8I

Today marks the beginning of Hispanic Heritage Month. This month we honor Latino and Hispanic Americans’ contributions to our nation. Amidst the COVID-19 pandemic Latinos are proving themselves more essential than ever and resilient in the face of adversity. #HHM https://t.co/hgP1RzETFO

As our economy recovers in the aftermath of the #COVID19 pandemic we must ensure that the implementation of AI and new technologies leads to a brighter more inclusive economic future for ALL Americans. https://t.co/WXLZzYYpNe

With over 6 million #COVID19 cases we need more resources to test trace and treat the virus. The #HeroesAct dedicates $75 billion to these life-saving efforts and the GOP must meet us halfway to put families first. https://t.co/CjfJeYiwLf

It's been over 100 days since the House passed the #HeroesAct to fight #COVID19. How many days must American families and frontline heroes go without desperately-needed support before Republicans in Congress are ready and willing to act? #HeroesAct https://t.co/cUhuJQRYdn

The Heroes Act would provide massive financial assistance and support to schools in Philadelphia as they navigate the current COVID crisis minefield. It would provide much needed money to schools in severe states of disrepair like Lowell and nearly a dozen others in Philly

Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay! Our nation is experiencing a significant shortage of poll workers due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Sign up to be a poll worker on November 3 here: https://t.co/xpxaNqO1Ln

You can’t fight #COVID19 without testing and contact tracing. President Trump has refused to develop and implement a national strategy and this #FailuretoLead is costing lives. This is a national crisis that requires a national strategy.  https://t.co/TjGuOvePDk

Small businesses have been hurt by #COVID19 and recent cutbacks at USPS. They need our help now more than ever. The Senate has no time to waste and must act with urgency to provide much needed relief to small business owners.  https://t.co/H9ogbaXLkf

Without the vote by mail option our country’s ability to carry out a safe and accessible election this Nov. is at serious risk particularly as we see a rise in #COVID19 cases. Voting by mail is safe and secure and we must make it easier to do so. https://t.co/A7fQog57LX

Child care has to be expanded and protected if parents want to safely return to work. That’s why I joined my colleagues in calling for the Child Care is Essential Act and the Child Care for Economic Recovery Act to be included in the next #COVID19 relief package. https://t.co/hgv4zvnBLJ

Essential workers are making tremendous sacrifices to serve others during COVID-19 and they need our support. I support the Child Care for Economic Recovery Act to provide $850 million to fill in gaps in dependent care for essential workers during the pandemic. #SaveChildCare https://t.co/wQbW6ii7gv

COVID-19 has devastated the child care sector forcing closures and exacerbating the shortage of quality affordable care. That’s why @HouseDemocrats are advancing two bills to provide relief for families and providers and support the safe reopening of our economy. #SaveChildCare https://t.co/wqXM9I7IpZ

We are seeing a similar pattern of #COVID19 cases that we saw at the start of this pandemic. We can help change the trajectory by following CDC guidelines to avoid a repeat of the spring. https://t.co/QCDblEZQKv
Today the Ways and Means Social Security Subcommittee is holding a virtual hearing to explore ways to mitigate the impacts of #coronavirus on Social Security. https://t.co/a4VEpuviMZ

As we celebrate National Park and Recreation month let's thank all of the staff providing services to preserve and protect our parks and recreational areas even throughout #COVID19.  https://t.co/YvDW9Rwlku
Wearing a mask is critical to curbing the spread of #COVID19. Be mindful of others and wear a mask when leaving the house. https://t.co/H4RIn06KLx

Through funding from the #CARESAct you may be eligible to apply for rental assistance if you are experiencing financial hardship due to #coronavirus. Check to see if you are eligible and apply. https://t.co/vxxRFPXNPz

Today the @HouseBudgetDems held a virtual hearing on the importance of science and the positive impacts of federal investments in R&D. As our nation grapples with the coronavirus pandemic & economic uncertainty these investments accelerate innovation & job growth. https://t.co/hSCEVXHfvn

The Trump Administration has repeatedly failed to effectively respond to the coronavirus and Vice President Pence seems to be just fine gambling with the lives of Pennsylvanians simply to further his boss’ pathetic political agenda. LINK TO FULL STMT: https://t.co/95JzohC9Iq https://t.co/f03nb6AoCP

My offices in Philadelphia have helped constituents reach a federal agency or apply for relief programs since #COVID19 began. You can now schedule an in-person appt. via phone or online. We will be implementing safety guidelines to keep our community safe. https://t.co/mDSgbgHW0J
The CDC added 3 new symptoms to the list of official #COVID19 symptoms. You can learn more below. https://t.co/4O733JMsSM
This Fall @TempleUniv will open a dedicated COVID-19 testing center on campus.   https://t.co/rt7PlZHo84

Testing saves lives. It is that simple. The Senate must take immediate action to provide more funding for testing capacity. An effort to slow down #coronavirus testing is a threat to Americans nationwide. https://t.co/YUzuxnfHfz
To promote the safety of our community Philadelphia now requires you to wear a mask. This small action can be critical to reducing the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/GDzT6vThbV

Nearly 125000 have been killed by the #coronavirus. More than 2.4 million are sick (and possibly much more). Millions are unemployed. And President Trump is still trying to tear away health coverage from countless Americans. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/btYsHoS0fF

As we continue to monitor how the #coronavirus is impacting our community my district offices in Philadelphia can help address any questions or concerns regarding federal assistance or programs. https://t.co/mDSgbgHW0J

As we begin to reopen our economy it is important to practice social distancing and other good habits that will help slow the spread of #COVID19. Wear a mask wash your hands frequently and avoid touching your face. https://t.co/hiNql2Bp2Y

Testing tracing and treatment are essential to controlling the spread of the #coronavirus. With nearly 120000 American lives lost and more on the line we need an aggressive plan to increase testing. https://t.co/NHMG1hatSs
Today I'm working with my @WaysMeansCmte colleagues to seek ways to provide much needed tax relief to support workers and families during the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/fUrYL8QAm7
I look forward to asking Amb. Lighthizer about our current and future trade agenda in response to the #coronavirus. https://t.co/eFUo1QBYZ5

Testing criteria has been expanded in Philadelphia. Even if you do not show symptoms you can get tested for #COVID19 if you have been near someone who may have had it. Check out where you can get tested for free below. https://t.co/hkCoZ8SCHk

As Philadelphia transitions into the yellow phase we must continue to practice good habits and take extra precautions when outdoors to limit the resurgence of #coronavirus cases. Below you can find some of the ways businesses have adapted. https://t.co/hY9lY17kB0

America is experiencing a time of incredible sadness – both as we fight COVID-19 and in the wake of the murder of #GeorgeFloyd.  Instead of uniting us President Trump is pouring salt on the wounds. America deserves better.

Tomorrow is Pennsylvania’s Primary Election Day. Polling locations have changed due to #coronavirus so make sure to check where you can vote beforehand. Your vote is needed now more than ever. We must vote to bring real change. (1/2) https://t.co/Y8ora8uZWU

Millions of Americans are unemployed and struggling to make rent or pay the mortgage due to the #coronavirus. Americans need help and Congress must quickly act to provide more funding for critical housing assistance.  https://t.co/7aWzUv1vVG

Don't forget to nominate a local hero to be publicly recognized in the weeks to come. A local hero can be anyone who is working to help the #PA02 community during this #COVID19 crisis.  https://t.co/mdXx04rYY3
The #coronavirus crisis should not be a food security crisis too. We must invest in critical food assistance programs like #SNAP and #WIC. https://t.co/fZXZMLe4eG

The #COVID19 pandemic continues to have a disproportionate impact on communities of color. In Philadelphia African Americans account for over 57% of deaths when the race is known and testing rates are still higher in more affluent zip codes. (1/2)  https://t.co/EHxi9sP8Mm

This #OlderAmericansMonth we celebrate the contributions seniors have made in our families and communities. As we continue to confront the #COVID19 pandemic we must ensure they have the support they need. https://t.co/xDVNcvSmQA
In order to safely reopen our country Congress must commit critical resources to the testing tracing & treatment of the #coronavirus. https://t.co/s1YsSiSdRk
To celebrate our local #COVID19 heroes I’m excited to announce my new initiative to recognize and highlight Philadelphians who go above and beyond when it comes to serving their communities. (1/2)

I want to expand #SocialSecurity and put money in the hands of those who need it most during #COVID19: seniors communities of color and people with disabilities - not corporations. (1/2)  https://t.co/TQSEMUOeon

As the #coronavirus pandemic keeps many of us at home we cannot forget those who are experiencing domestic abuse. Congress must continue to provide additional funding for Violence Against Women Act programs that protect the vulnerable. https://t.co/gSphRt4tJ6

As we continue to monitor how the #coronavirus is impacting our communities my goal is to keep everyone as informed as possible. My district offices are operating virtually to help address any questions or concerns. https://t.co/mDSgbgHW0J

We have all been impacted by the tireless efforts that health care workers have made during the #COVID19 pandemic. This National Hospital Week I want to thank all #PAHealthCareHeroes as they dedicate care and compassion to keep our communities safe. #HospitalWeek #PAHospitals https://t.co/9xtmL5QX1S

The Treasury Department has created a website to warn against the ongoing #coronavirus scams that have increased over the past weeks. If you were a victim of an IRS-related coronavirus scam you can report it here: https://t.co/e05APDtXTO

To support essential workers SEPTA will operate on regular schedule for most services beginning on May 17. While additional safety measures will be enforced please make sure to wear masks and follow CDC guidelines to prevent the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/yCyiHqJzq8

We must recognize that some states are depleting resources at a faster rate given the higher number of #COVID19 cases and we must ensure that resources are fairly distributed by considering the number of cases and the impact the virus has on the local government’s budget. https://t.co/3xJYGRj1SK

With recent reports of several White House staffers testing positive for COVID-19 the President and his staff should be quarantining and self-distancing—not traveling to a November swing state to gas up his flaccid poll numbers. https://t.co/am2OSRxEdj

This #NationalNursesWeek I stand in solidarity with nurses across the nation as they demand the protections they need to do their jobs safely during the #COVID19 crisis. We need more PPE to #ProtectNurses who are on the front lines of this global fight. https://t.co/emUhggh2dn

We should be strengthening #SocialSecurity not giving a payroll tax cut to corporations. I'm proud to join @RepJohnLarson on the Emergency Social Security Benefits Improvement Act to help our seniors during the #COVID19 crisis. #ExpandSocialSecurity https://t.co/Y8xdOA3MXC

My staff has been working remotely to help #PA02 during #COVID19. When a Vietnam Veteran's pension suddenly stopped in the middle of this crisis my staff worked with the Dept. of VA to restart it. If you need any federal assistance contact my office. https://t.co/mDSgbgHW0J

#COVID19 has revealed the tireless dedication of our nation’s teachers. This #TeacherAppreciationWeek we thank our teachers who are going above and beyond to serve their students. #ThankATeacher https://t.co/TNVJtFe9Gm

Since the start of the #COVID19 crisis @AFSCME workers including @afscmecouncil13 have stepped up to serve their communities on the front lines of this global fight. We are thankful for your sacrifice and commitment to help others. https://t.co/oTs1Zh5TtQ

Today as we honor the #FreedomRiders and all the heroes of the civil rights movement we must recommit ourselves to their fight for justice and equality. This #COVID19 crisis is shining a light upon the fundamental inequalities of our nation that we must work to correct. https://t.co/K6Axmietg3

I’m continuing to share updates regarding the ongoing #COVID19 public health crisis and some resources that you may find beneficial on my website. For any questions don't hesitate to contact my district offices. https://t.co/HykxLccz9e
The CDC just added to the list of official #COVID19 symptoms. In response Philadelphia has expanded the parameters that qualify people for a test. You can learn more below. https://t.co/CAVdgGqGjd

More and more Americans are facing food insecurity during #COVID19. I'll keep fighting to increase SNAP in Congress. In the meantime my staff continues to address these shortcomings by helping to get food to those who are at higher risk or unable to travel to a food site. (1/2)

On #WorkersMemorialDay we must recommit to making workplaces safer. As we endure this pandemic we need to protect health care workers first responders and other essential workers on the frontlines of the fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/nvD358R6en

Starting at 1:45pm tomorrow (4/28) the U.S. Navy Blue Angels will be doing a joint flyover to honor the frontline #COVID19 responders and essential workers in the Philadelphia area. Look to the skies from your home to catch the flyover! https://t.co/dqHW8wStIG
Looking for your #coronavirus stimulus check? Here is brief guidance of when to expect payments. https://t.co/5btGdH2ita

My office is actively working from home to ensure #PA02 families are receiving the relief they need during this difficult time. You can visit my website for FAQs related to #COVID19 and contact my district offices for any help or  questions. https://t.co/HykxLccz9e
Thank you to our heroes who are keeping us safe and healthy during #COVID19. https://t.co/mzMwue57GP

Over 26 million Americans have been forced out of work. Congress must act to end mass layoffs and keep workers in their jobs. I’m proud to be an original cosponsor of the Paycheck Guarantee Act which will combat the mass unemployment caused by #COVID19. https://t.co/uOMIwVYCCm

.@senatemajldr is saying he would rather see states go bankrupt than deliver lifesaving relief. How does this help our firefighters police & EMS fight #COVID19? Lives are at risk. Proud to have joined this effort to fight for more funding for local & state gov. in the next bill. https://t.co/poq4ylaEVd

I'm proud to cosponsor the Protect Our Post Offices Act which provides $25 billion to USPS to sustain its operations during #COVID19. As the third largest employer and a reliable distributor of all mail we must provide additional funds to USPS. https://t.co/qvBmXQgo7Z

Earlier this month over 60 colleagues and I sent a letter calling for recurring monthly payments during #COVID19. The American people are depending on their federal government to get through this crisis and this will ensure families will have the immediate relief they need. https://t.co/Ps9vkJF2br

The PA Dept of Labor is now accepting applications for non-traditional unemployment filers (e.g. self-employed workers independent contractors gig workers). If you file a 1099 and your work has been affected by #COVID19 you may be eligible for benefits. https://t.co/oH3A9LJbBf

This week I led a bipartisan letter to Sec. DeVos to clarify the changes to student loans and its impact on Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) Program. As the PSLF caucus co-chair I am working to ensure #COVID19 does not affect your eligibility for loan forgiveness. https://t.co/IDxiB4jexl

Thank you to @PennaNurses and all health care workers who are on the front lines of the fight to stop the #coronavirus. We must do more to support them and provide much needed resources to protect them. #WeNeedItNow https://t.co/gKQL1dey0C

Through the #COVID19 crisis we are again reminded of the important role teachers play. Thank you to our nation's teachers who are going above and beyond to help our students during this time. https://t.co/pWg75bZItY

The @CDCgov released new recommendations on how to protect yourself from #COVID19 while running essential errands like grocery shopping ordering take-out and going to see a healthcare provide. https://t.co/oUPolMkQKJ

This #coronavirus crisis is hard on everyone and it’s showing how the actions of our community impact us all. #Census2020 will determine the public health funding that our community gets for the next decade. Please respond online now ⬇️ #WeCount  https://t.co/135rQTetwd

The Treasury Department has created a new website to warn against the ongoing #coronavirus scams that have increased over the past weeks. If you are a victim of an IRS-related coronavirus scam you can report it here: https://t.co/0P0WMwBGhi
Why @fema would close a testing site just as the @WhiteHouse classified Philadelphia as a potential #COVID hot spot--is deeply troubling. https://t.co/qYshwpTEqu

Far too many Philadelphians are facing economic hardships due to #COVID19. Congress must take steps to further expand unemployment insurance to protect working families nationwide. https://t.co/7JFhhNBMPc

For millions of Americans sheltering in place due to #COVID19 can be dangerous particularly those in #DomesticAbuse situations. We must expand protections for survivors of domestic violence & sexual assault by passing the Violence Against Women Reauthorization Act. #VAWA4ALL https://t.co/Eo2IT0j26V
Learn more about #COVID19 response efforts and resources available to Pennsylvania Veterans at the Veterans Benefits Administration’s tele-townhall at 4pm today. https://t.co/Y6h34aV3nj

As I continue to work on a federal response that will keep #PA02 families safe please stay informed by visiting my web page where you can find information related to the #COVID19 public health crisis. https://t.co/HykxLccz9e

While we are all intensely focused on #COVID19 related issues today is #CensusDay.   You can fill out your #Census2020 form today or anytime in the next few weeks at https://t.co/ILIQDBXyE0 and help our community get the resources that it needs for hospitals and schools. https://t.co/ndQa49VwjD
We owe our retail workers who are making huge sacrifices to help us access necessary goods to sustain our lives during the #COVID19 crisis. Thank you! https://t.co/G9YCgCVD9d
Are you a small business owner in Philadelphia? You may qualify for grants or zero-interest loans if your business is impacted by the #COVID19 pandemic. Learn more below. https://t.co/J16js1kaqa

The simplest safest and healthiest gift we can give to our MD's on this #NationalDoctorsDay--is to just stay home. This gift would help to #flattenthecurve for our healthcare workers battling #COVID19 and bring them home as well.

Tomorrow afternoon (3/31/20) I will be hosting a telephone town hall at 12:15pm on recent Congressional relief actions involving the Coronavirus pandemic.  If you would like to join please click here and register:  https://t.co/BXY0qTnmTB
Infinite gratitude for our Philadelphia frontline healthcare and public safety workers as they help us navigate this #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/IjkcS2bnul

Let's take a moment to thank our frontline health care workers and first responders. Your sacrifice and  commitment to fight the #coronavirus pandemic is not unnoticed. https://t.co/uEWekneHT4

We can't let the rise of racism and violence toward AAPIs  go unaddressed. That's why I am an original cosponsor of a resolution condemning all forms of anti-Asian sentiment related to #COVID19 with my @CAPAC colleagues. Together we must end these attacks on AAPI communities.

A few ways to keep both you and our workers safe during #COVID19 outbreak. https://t.co/PO6sn1HrZe

#FamiliesFirst #Coronavirus Response Act expands food assistance:   - $500M to help low-income pregnant women and mothers with young children  - $400M to help local food banks  - $250M to provide home-delivered and pre-packaged meal to low-income seniors https://t.co/OJ6rF10NDP
You can’t fight an enemy you can’t see. That’s why the #FamiliesFirst Act makes #coronavirus testing free to all. Congress must pass this legislation immediately. https://t.co/cjbt6W3leU

To all of our first responders health professionals cleaning staff and so many others who are helping our nation battle this #COVID19 pandemic: thank you.   We are in tremendous debt to each of them. https://t.co/hf17spv0pG
